medical_history.chief_complaint: The child began experiencing seizures one hour after birth.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Seizures started one hour after birth, occurring 5-6 times a day and lasting around 10 seconds each. Seizures were characterized by head tilting back, upper left eyes staring, hands clenching, upper limbs flexing and shaking, treadmill movements of lower limbs, and purple coloration around the mouth. These seizures continued with the same presentation on the 18th day after birth. Seizures were gradually controlled after one and a half years. Following a cold, the child developed pneumonia and respiratory failure accompanied by seizures, leading to her admission to the emergency intensive care unit.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Global developmental delay and hypertonia; no history of asphyxia, hypoglycemia, or pathological jaundice during the perinatal period.
medical_history.family_history: The family is described as a normal couple without close relatives; family history is negative.
